content.description:
Some nice feet on the arete of the crack wall at the beginning peter out a third of the way to make for a pretty blank extended crux that ends with a difficult mantle. A couple of easier moves for a second mantle will get you up to the anchors. 

  Definitely requires solid off-width technique. Long sleeves recommended.
content.protection:
#5 and #6 C4s 

  Bolted anchor with chain and rap rings
content.location: Once you meet the cliff line above Shadow of a Man, walk to the right past the roof. The wide crack is in a left-facing dihedral

content.description: Awkward moves in a short fist crack lead to a ledge underneath a roof. Once you figure out how to stand up underneath the roof, one kind-of-airy move will get you above it, then a short army crawl will put you in reach of the anchors.
content.protection:
Standard rack, maybe an extra #3 C4, maybe a #4 to protect the easy move to mantle at the top of the crack.  

  Bolted anchor with chain and rap rings
content.location: Right facing crack to your left when you meet the cliff line on the trail from Shadow of a Man

content.description: A nice(although short) line that starts as fingers and gets gradually wider after a small ledge. There are a few face holds to pull on when the crack turns to wide hands near the top.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Bolted anchors have recently been installed at the top.
content.location: This crack is located near the point where the main trail meets the cliff line by shadow of a man. When you meet the cliff line, there will be a wide crack slightly to your left. Turn right and follow the cliff for a few yards.Look for the obvious crack next to a small tree.

content.description: Extensive bluff along the eastern edge of the Holy Boulders property. Seem to stay pretty shady when the leaves are on the trees, expect it gets enough sun to stay warm in the winter.
